puakma.addin
Class pmaAddIn

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      puakma.addin.pmaAddIn
All Implemented Interfaces:
ErrorDetect, java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AGENDA, CLUSTER, HSQLDB, HTTP, MAILER, WIDGIE
public class pmaAddIn
extends java.lang.Thread
implements ErrorDetect

This is the skeleton for a server addin task. Typically there will be many of these running like servlets performing a whole raft of functions pmaAddIn pAddIn; pAddIn = (pmaAddIn)Class.forName(szAddInName).newInstance(); pAddIn.init(pSystem); vAddIns.addElement(pAddIn); //so we can track all addins loaded pAddIn.start();

canLoadMultiple

public boolean canLoadMultiple()
Determines if the addin may be loaded multiple times. Default is true. Override this and return false if the addin may be loaded only once (eg Mailer)

addInReady

public boolean addInReady()
Determines if the addin has completed all its startup processes correctly. Default is true. Override this and return false if the addin is not yet ready for work. Note: pmaServer will call this method and wait until it returns true. This will allow addins to load in order in case one addin relies on another. See: AddIns= line in puakma.config

registerThisAddInToReceiveLogMessages

public void registerThisAddInToReceiveLogMessages()
Tell the logging mechanism to send log events to this addin

deregisterThisAddInToReceiveLogMessages

public void deregisterThisAddInToReceiveLogMessages()
Tell the logging mechanism to no longer send log events to this addin
